amendatorysection.catchline: Hotel; occupancy; county; impose sales tax; when.
amendatorysection.para: (1) The governing body of any county may after a public hearing adopt a resolution to impose an additional sales tax of not to exceed two percent upon the total consideration charged for occupancy of any space furnished by any hotel if such county has created a County Visitors Promotion Fund and a visitors committee pursuant to section 81-1255. The proceeds from such tax shall be paid to the County Visitors Promotion Fund.

(2) The governing body of any county may after a public hearing adopt a resolution to impose an additional sales tax of not to exceed two percent upon the total consideration charged for occupancy of any space furnished by any hotel if such county has created a County Visitors Improvement Fund and a visitors committee pursuant to section 81-1255. The proceeds from such tax shall be paid to the County Visitors Improvement Fund.
(3) The taxes authorized by this section shall be in addition to the tax authorized in section 81-1253 or any other sales tax imposed or authorized.
